docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 30 On instructions from Argentina's military rulers, newspapers here omitted all mention last week of charges of human rights violations leveled against Argentine authorities in a report by the Inter-American Human Rights...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 30 On instructions from Argentina's military rulers, newspapers here omitted all mention last week of charges of human rights violations leveled against Argentine authorities in a report by the Inter-American Human Rights Commission.
docs.abstract: Inter-American Commission on Human Rights condemns authorities for human rights violations; OAS votes, 19-2, to condemn authorities (S)

headline.main: POPE'S RIGHTS PLEA SHAKES ARGENTINES; Papers, Silent on Critical O.A.S. Report, Give Wide Coverage to Appeal on Prisoners

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: "THAT'S a good investment, sir," a clerk at Eggers   Silk on Fulton Street told Kenneth G. DeWitt, a Wall Street securities manager, as he fitted a pair of deep burgundy Church's Chepstow wingtips on Mr. DeWitt's feet the other day.
docs.lead_paragraph: "THAT'S a good investment, sir," a clerk at Eggers Silk on Fulton Street told Kenneth G. DeWitt, a Wall Street securities manager, as he fitted a pair of deep burgundy Church's Chepstow wingtips on Mr. DeWitt's feet the other day.
docs.abstract: Article on soaring prices of shoes because of rising cost of leather; American Footwear Industry Assn says supply of hides available to American shoe manufacturers began to diminish significantly about 2 years; in 1st 8 months of '79, wholesale shoe prices increased nearly 19% over same period in '78; assn president Fred Meister and Commerce Dept analyst Virginia Mannering and consumers comment; drawing (M)

headline.main: Shoe Prices Off and Running; The Prices of Shoes Are Off and Running

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO Coca-Cola of Brazil, already the leader in the world's fifth-largest soft-drink market, is bidding for a larger share with a sprightly advertising and marketing campaign to introduce its new guarana soda called Tai.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO Coca-Cola of Brazil, already the leader in the world's fifth-largest soft-drink market, is bidding for a larger share with a sprightly advertising and marketing campaign to introduce its new guarana soda called Tai.
docs.abstract: Coca-Cola of Brazil, already leader in world's 5th largest soft-drink market, bids for larger share with advertising and marketing campaign to introduce its new guarana soda called Tai; major producers of guarana--Antartica, with 42% of Brazilian market and export sales in France, and Brahma, with 34% in Brazil and additional sales in Europe--have been stirred into new action by Coca-Cola challenge and have responded with marketing challenges and high-priced publicity of their own; Coca-Cola public affairs manager Roberto de Andrada comments; illus (M)

headline.main: Coca-Cola's Subsidiary in Brazil Joins the Guarana Generation; 'A Showcase for the Future' Capturing Coke's Trademark

byline.original: By WARREN HOGE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 2 The Bolivian armed forces have produced more instability than order and progress in their backward country through chronic intervention in national politics.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 2 The Bolivian armed forces have produced more instability than order and progress in their backward country through chronic intervention in national politics.

headline.main: Military Intervention: Old Story in Bolivia; News Analysis

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 8 (AP) Nick Saviano traded match points with Stan Smith in the final set and then won a tiebreaker and the match, 6-7, 6-4, 7-6, today to advance to the third round of the Stockholm open tennis championships.
docs.lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 8 (AP) Nick Saviano traded match points with Stan Smith in the final set and then won a tiebreaker and the match, 6-7, 6-4, 7-6, today to advance to the third round of the Stockholm open tennis championships.

headline.main: Saviano Tops Smith In Stockholm Tennis; Mrs. King Upset

headline.main: Notes on People; Pursuing the Offenders Wherever the Trail May Lead A Fantastic, Educational Job With Only One Drawback An Offer That Joseph Papp Couldn't Refuse A Vote for Fish Jr. On Gretting Into Politics Political Tie-Breaker

docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia The Government of Colombia, resiliently democratic on a continent prone to military rule, has come under criticism for having ceded too much power to the armed forces in its successful drive on urban guerrillas.
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia The Government of Colombia, resiliently democratic on a continent prone to military rule, has come under criticism for having ceded too much power to the armed forces in its successful drive on urban guerrillas.

headline.main: Colombia Regime Accused of Ceding Rule to Army; 382 to Be Put on Trial
